benchmark_details.name: AGIBench: A Multi-granularity, Multimodal, Human-referenced, Auto-scoring Benchmark for Large Language Models
benchmark_details.overview: AGIBench is a multi-granularity, multimodal, human-referenced, and auto-scoring benchmarking methodology for evaluating large language models (LLMs), focusing on diverse question types and difficulty levels.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for evaluating the question-solving abilities and intelligence of LLMs.

data.source: Questions are primarily sourced from national civil service examinations.
data.annotation: Questions are labeled with a four-tuple <ability branch, knowledge, difficulty, modal>.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the accuracy of responses from multiple evaluations of the same questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy reflects better performance of LLMs in understanding and answering questions across various difficulties and modalities.
methodology.validation: Validation through experiments on twelve LLMs.
